item.title: Robust Earnings Growth Marks Dec-2025 Quarter as Majority of Stocks Report Positive Results
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has unfolded with a notable improvement in positive results, as 55.0% of the 428 companies reporting have posted favourable outcomes, marking a significant uptick from the preceding quarters. While mid and small caps continue to outperform large caps in terms of positive earnings surprises, sectoral leaders and individual standouts have emerged, painting a nuanced picture of corporate profitability and growth trends. Time: 3 minutes ago

item.title: Loyal Equipments Ltd Drops 6.87%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Decline
item.description: Loyal Equipments Ltd’s shares declined by 6.87% over the week ending 23 January 2026, closing at Rs.176.95 from Rs.190.00 the previous Friday. This underperformance came despite the Sensex falling 3.31% over the same period, indicating a sharper drop for the stock amid weak financial results, technical deterioration, and waning institutional interest. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Shanthi Gears Surges 10.88% Amid Volatility and Earnings Pressure
item.description: Shanthi Gears Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, gaining 10.88% from Rs.407.15 to Rs.451.45 between 19 and 23 January 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex which declined 3.31% over the same period. The stock’s rally was marked by a notable intraday high of Rs.472.70 on 22 January, driven by a surge in buying interest despite mixed financial results and technical signals. This review analyses the key events and price movements shaping the stock’s volatile week. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Praj Industries Falls 8.76% This Week: 5 Key Factors Behind the Decline

item.title: Mangalore Refinery & Petrochemicals Ltd Gains 2.51%: 5 Key Factors Driving the Week
item.description: Mangalore Refinery & Petrochemicals Ltd. (MRPL) closed the week ending 23 January 2026 with a modest gain of 2.51%, rising from Rs.151.55 to Rs.155.35. The week was marked by a mix of technical shifts, strong trading volumes, and renewed investor interest, culminating in a cautious but positive momentum for the stock. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: City Union Bank Gains 1.03%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Momentum

item.title: Symphony Ltd. Falls 5.04%: Downgrade and Bearish Momentum Shape Weekly Decline

This decline outpaced the Sensex’s 3.31% fall over the same period, reflecting intensified selling pressure amid a downgrade to Strong Sell and a shift towards bearish technical momentum. item.title: Rajratan Global Wire Ltd Falls 13.20%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Decline

item.title: Azad India Mobility Ltd Falls 22.49%: 2 Key Technical Factors Driving the Decline
